thread.title: SignalShare and Clair Global provide network connectivity for Pope Francis' visit to Philadelphia
thread.title_full: SignalShare and Clair Global provide network connectivity for Pope Francis' visit to Philadelphia

title: SignalShare and Clair Global provide network connectivity for Pope Francis' visit to Philadelphia
text:
SignalShare and Clair Global provide network connectivity for Pope Francis' visit to Philadelphia Network allows crowds to stay connected during Pope Francis' Sunday Mass in Philadelphia September 28, 2015 -- 
HACKENSACK, N.J. , Sept. 28, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- SignalShare (OTCQB: RMLX), the leading provider of end-to-end high-density consumer engagement and wireless Internet solutions, partnered with Clair Global to lead the deployment of a temporary Wi-Fi network in support of Pope Francis' public Mass in Philadelphia on Sunday. With this network, spectators who came to see the pope were provided with high-speed Wi-Fi connectivity, allowing them to share photos, stream the event and follow news. 
Live Nation, the organizer of this event, tapped SignalShare to provide network infrastructure after several previous successful partnerships. Crew and tech teams spent two weeks building the network, which stretched from the "Rocky" steps at the Philadelphia Museum of Art to the city center, providing Internet access for the crowd of over 800,000 spectators. The network included 400 wired media connections and hundreds of Wi-Fi ports to service media risers, where reporters from all over the world had gathered for the event. 
SignalShare's network also facilitated security and technical operations, allowing event personnel to scan tickets, detect fraud and coordinate lighting and video. 
"SignalShare has significant experience building temporary and permanent Wi-Fi infrastructure, and our experience with building high-density networks and consumer engagement solutions, as well as our proven track record in the event space made us a natural fit to provide services for this type of event," said Joe Costanzo , chief technology officer of SignalShare. "We couldn't be more honored to have our infrastructure serve as the backbone for Pope Francis' historic visit to Philadelphia ." 
About SignalShare SignalShare (OTCQB: RMLX) is the first end-to-end consumer engagement solution for venues and events that does more than simply get audiences online. The company's proprietary platform allows venues to use their wireless networks to gather data-rich insights about crowd and user behavior and leverage those insights to create engaging experiences and sponsorship opportunities that grow revenue. SignalShare also has extensive experience designing and implementing customized wireless networks in complex environments. Top sports, entertainment and corporate brands, including, IBM, the Sands Expo and Convention Center, the Detroit Red Wings and AEG rely on SignalShare to provide exceptional audience experiences and grow their revenue. SignalShare is a division of Signal Point Holdings Corp and is headquartered in Hackensack, N.J. For more information, go to www.SignalShare.com or visit us on Twitter @SignalShare .
